greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Expansion of (b(q) / b(q^2))^2 in powers of q where b() is a cubic AGM theta function.
comment: Ramanujan theta functions: f(q) (see A121373), phi(q) (A000122), psi(q) (A010054), chi(q) (A000700).
Cubic AGM theta functions: a(q) (see A004016), b(q) (A005928), c(q) (A005882).
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
formula: Expansion of (chi(-q)^3 / chi(-q^3))^2 in powers of q where chi() is a Ramanujan theta function.
Expansion of (eta(q)^3 * eta(q^6) / (eta(q^2)^3 * eta(q^3)))^2 in powers of q.
G.f. is a period 1 Fourier series which satisfies f(-1 / (18 t)) = 4 g(t) where q = exp(2 Pi i t) and g() is g.f. for A216046.
a(n) ~ (-1)^n * exp(2*Pi*sqrt(2*n)/3) / (2^(3/4) * sqrt(3) * n^(3/4)). - _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Nov 16 2017
mathematica: a[ n_] := SeriesCoefficient[ (QPochhammer[ x, x^2]^3 / QPochhammer[ x^3, x^6])^2, {x, 0, n}];
program: (PARI) {a(n) = local(A); if( n<0, 0, A = x * O(x^n); polcoeff( (eta(x + A)^3 * eta(x^6 + A) / (eta(x^2 + A)^3 * eta(x^3 + A)))^2, n))};
results.author: _Michael Somos_, May 13 2014
